```{r helper-functions}
tablena <- function(x) {
  table(x, useNA = 'always')
}

in_millions <- function(dt, round_to = 3, do_round = TRUE) {
  dt <- as.data.table(dt)
  cols <- c('estimate', 'se', '2.5 %', '97.5 %')
  sub_dt <- dt[, cols, with = FALSE] / 10^6
  if (do_round) {
    sub_dt <- round(sub_dt, round_to)
  }
  dt[, (cols) := sub_dt]
  dt
}

rounded <- function(dt, round_to = 3) {
  cols <- c('estimate', 'se', '2.5 %', '97.5 %')
  sub_dt <- round(dt[, cols, with = FALSE], round_to)
  dt[, (cols) := sub_dt]
  dt
}

has_level <- function(x, ids) {
  is.element(as.integer(x), ids)
}

standard_millions_plot <- function(data) {
  ggplot(
    data = data,
    mapping = aes(
      y = reorder(level, estimate)
    )
  ) +
  geom_point(
    aes(
      x = estimate
    ),
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      yend = reorder(level, estimate),
      x = `2.5 %`,
      xend = `97.5 %`
    ),
    arrow = arrow(angle = 90, ends = 'both', length = unit(0.075, 'inches')),
    size = 0.5
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    labels = scales::label_number(suffix = 'M', accuracy = 0.1),
  ) +
  scale_y_discrete(
    labels = scales::wrap_format(50)
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    axis.title.y = element_blank()
  )
}

standard_proportions_plot <- function(data) {
  ggplot(
  data = data,
  mapping = aes(
    y = reorder(level, estimate)
  )
) +
  geom_point(
    aes(
      x = estimate
    ),
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_segment(
    aes(
      yend = reorder(level, estimate),
      x = `2.5 %`,
      xend = `97.5 %`
    ),
    arrow = arrow(angle = 90, ends = 'both', length = unit(0.075, 'inches')),
    size = 0.5
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = seq(0, 1, 0.1),
    expand = c(0, 0),
    labels = scales::label_percent(1),
    limits = c(0, 1)
  ) +
  scale_y_discrete(
    labels = scales::wrap_format(50)
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    legend.position = 'none'
  )
}

env <- new.env()

env$estimates <- data.table()

collect_estimate <- function(est, title, domain = '', type = '', round_to = 3, plot = FALSE) {
  this_title <- title
  this_domain <- domain
  this_type <- type

  if (type == 'total') {
    dt <- in_millions(est, round_to)
  } else if (type == 'proportion') {
    dt <- rounded(est, round_to)
  } else {
    dt <- as.data.table(est)
  }
  env$estimates <- rbindlist(list(
    env$estimates[
      !(
        title == this_title &
          domain == this_domain &
          type == this_type
      )
    ],
    dt[, .(
      domain = this_domain,
      title = this_title,
      type = this_type,
      level,
      estimate,
      se,
      `2.5 %`,
      `97.5 %`
    )]
  ))

  env$estimates[
    title == this_title &
      domain == this_domain &
      type == this_type
  ]
}
```

fem_2017_2019_data <- copy(fem_2017_2019$Data[, .(
  CASEID,

  CURRMETH2 = factorize(CURRMETH2, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  CURRMETH3 = factorize(CURRMETH3, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  CURRMETH4 = factorize(CURRMETH4, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  LSTMONMETH1 = factorize(LSTMONMETH1, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  LSTMONMETH2 = factorize(LSTMONMETH2, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  LSTMONMETH3 = factorize(LSTMONMETH3, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  LSTMONMETH4 = factorize(LSTMONMETH4, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  SECU,
  SEST,
  WGT2017_2019,
  YUSEPILL1 = factorize(YUSEPILL1, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  YUSEPILL2 = factorize(YUSEPILL2, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  YUSEPILL3 = factorize(YUSEPILL3, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  YUSEPILL4 = factorize(YUSEPILL4, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  YUSEPILL5 = factorize(YUSEPILL5, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
  YUSEPILL6 = factorize(YUSEPILL6, 'YUSEMTHF', fem_2017_2019_formats)
)])

# create boolean variables for whether each specific method is reported as used in month of interview
for (x in c(1:26, 55, 98:99)) {
  set(
    fem_2017_2019_data,
    j = sprintf('thismonth_meth%d', x),
    value = has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$CURRMETH1, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$CURRMETH2, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$CURRMETH3, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$CURRMETH4, x)
  )
}

# create boolean variables for whether each specific method is reported as used in month preceding interview
for (x in c(1:26, 55, 98:99)) {
  set(
    fem_2017_2019_data,
    j = sprintf('lastmonth_meth%d', x),
    value = has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$LSTMONMETH1, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$LSTMONMETH2, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$LSTMONMETH3, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$LSTMONMETH4, x)
  )
}

# create boolean variables for whether each specific reason is reported as motivating use of the pill
for (x in 1:10) {
  set(
    fem_2017_2019_data,
    j = sprintf('whypill_reason%d', x),
    value = has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL1, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL2, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL3, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL4, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL5, x) |
      has_level(fem_2017_2019_data$YUSEPILL6, x)
  )
}

# create boolean variables for whether each specific method is reporte das used in either month of inteview or preceding month
for (x in c(1:26, 55, 98:99)) {
  set(
    fem_2017_2019_data,
    j = sprintf('twomonths_meth%d', x),
    value = fem_2017_2019_data[, get(sprintf('thismonth_meth%d', x))] |
      fem_2017_2019_data[, get(sprintf('lastmonth_meth%d', x))]
  )
}

# Females

## Contraceptive Methods Reported Used in Month of Interview or Preceding Month

```{r, dependson=c('fem-process-data')}
collect_estimate(
  rbindlist(lapply(
    c(1:26, 55, 98:99),
    function(x) {
      svyci(
        as.formula(sprintf('~twomonths_meth%d', x)),
        fem_2017_2019_svy,
        svytotal
      )[
        level == TRUE
      ][
        , .(level = x, estimate, se, `2.5 %`, `97.5 %`)
      ]
    }
  ))[
    order(-estimate),
    .(
      level = factorize(level, 'METHHXF', fem_2017_2019_formats),
      estimate, se, `2.5 %`, `97.5 %`
    )
  ],
  type = 'total',
  domain = 'females aged 15-49 in households in the United States',
  title = 'by contraceptive method used in month of interview or preceding month'
)[, .(level, estimate, se, `2.5 %`, `97.5 %`)] |> kable()
```

# Things to Investigate

* Use for reasons other than contraception
* Not sexually active with opposite sex
    * Never versus past 3 months
    * Same-sex partner(s)
* Among those at risk for unintended pregnancy, why not using contraception
* Why respondents believe themselves to be sterile
* Ever tried over lifetime and why quit
* Consistency
* Time periods of contraceptive use for unintended pregnancy detection and efficacy/failure rate estimation
* Replace analysis in SAS
    * Attempt single-factor categorical data analysis, e.g., whether totals of otherwise not using contraception and currently trying to conceive are different
* Combining with 2015-2017 data for more precise estimates
* Nonresponse bias by comparing second phase vs. first-phase

## Covariates/Subdomains

* Want children in future, but not just not now
* By sex education
* By income
* By religiosity
